review_blob: Bottle purchased from local store in Northwest.  Poured black with 0 head and 0 Head retention.  This beer had the aroma of   burnt bacon (Not Good).  I would compare the flavor to chewing on a used match extremely harsh.  As I choked this one down  my stomach began to rumble causing me to run to the head and lose it all.  I woke up with the worst hangover I have ever had and I did not even catch a buzz.  BUMMER!

Aroma is very green pine and simple.  Poured a dark gold with a small head that quickly dissapated.  Overall the taste of this one could use improvement I did not get any real hop presence and the body was very thin.  As far as American Pale Ales go there are a bunch out there that make this below average.  I would not go here again.
beer_name: Real Ale Rio Blanco Pale Ale

review_blob: Aroma comes off fruity peach/orange not really the best aroma for what I was expecting.  Amber color is reminiscent of every other out there.  Flavor was right in the middle for me, perhaps a bit to ordinary?  I picked up some acidity in the flavor with slight diacetyl.  Heavy on the hops but more earthy than fruity.  I would definitely drink again!

Aroma and appearance are a bit lacking.  Clear light blonde with zero head retention and a mostly non-existent nose with hints of earthy pine.  Unfortunately I was hoping this would quench my thirst on a hot Arizona day but no luck...  Body was thin and flavor?  What flavor not much to this one.  There are definitely more true to style Kolsch beers out there.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle brought back from N.M. from a friend.  Aroma is roasted chocolate with a slightly earthy nose.  1/2 inch head stayed with the beer and left great lacing til the end.  I think the flavor of this Porter is one of the better out there.  It is very silky due to the bottle conditioning I believe.  The flavor is roast coffee, chocolate, finished with a hint of bitter sweetness.  I could drink 6 of these at a sitting no problem and at 6.4% be pretty happy.  I highly reccomend this one to any Porter fan.

Pours with a small off-white head that disappears almost right away.  Aroma is either off or I got a bottle that is funked or has some very old hops pitched in for the aroma.   Flavor is very unbalanced there is just a huge bitterness that does not have any malt character to back it up.  I would have a tough time chewing through the rest of this bottle.  Overall I would stay away.

Tasted this one at the Great Arizona Beer Festival on tap and I expected something much better.  Aroma was slightly sour chocolate.  Appearance was the only thing going for this beer, a typical dark brownish color.  Flavor was overwhelmingly watery; very thin witha slight roast chocolate finish.  Unfortunately I had to dump the last bit of this one!  I was expecting so much more.
beer_name: Big Sky Moose Drool Brown Ale

review_blob: Poured from a 22 oz. bomber bottle.  Head is thick with nice lacing and a great big grapefruit nose.   Flavor is big caramel malt; for a barley wine I was expecting something a little sweeter but the balance was very palatable.  I would reccomend this Barley Wine to anyone that enjoys the style.  Cheers!
beer_name: Santa Fe Chicken Killer Barley Wine

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Bottle conditioning means better beer in my book.  This one pours a bit hazy with a deep golden color and a thick 3/4 inch head.  The nose is resplendant with big grapefruit hints probably lots of Chinook hops?  Flavor is extremely complex with a big body backed up with a crisp almost dry hoppy finish.  This beer can stand up to almost anything.  I certainly enjoy the palate of this and will drink many as I grow older.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Blue Dot Double IPA

review_blob: Poured from a 12 ounce bottle.  Aroma was very subtle maybe the beer had been a bit out of date?  A light amber color with decent lacing ans a 1/4 inch head.  Flavor was a bit dissapointing very bland malt profile with some bland hop finish.  Overall I would pass on this next time, the palate was ruined maybe it would be a different story on tap?

Where is the aroma in this beer?  Poured a light amber hue with little to no head retention.  I expected a more full bodied and balanced beer.  This one had a very easy drinking finish and no real character, what hops are they using?  it is a bitter right?  Perfect for the entry craft beer drinker.  I would give this beer an average at best score there are many other beers out there with quality ingredients.

Pours better from a bottle due to bottle conditioning, aroma is nice sweet chocolate.  I have experienced from both bottle and tap.  BOTTLE is better with a pine hop finish and slight roastiness.  For a robust porter this is a little on the weak side for me.  Balance seems just right and I see myself drinking another.  Overall a decent american robust porter.

On tap at a local place.  This beer has a chocolate nose and if I were eating a cookie, might be better.  The flavor is nice with hints of milk but the palate seems a bit thin.  Overall a decent twist on a dry stout.

Bottle pours a darker amber than I think most in amber style.  Head is thick off-white with good retention.  Nose is full of citrus lemon.  Flavor has a nice balance with bready toffee sweetness in the finish.  Overall an average at best Pale Ale with a slighlty weak body.

Bottle poured a little undercarbonated.  Light amber in color with a white head that lasted 10 seconds.  The flavor that is overwhelming in this one is CHALK?  I dont know if I have ever tasted a flavor like this before,  there is no balance I taste just a slight caramel malt.  I think this beer would be a tough session beer.  There are much better amber ales out there.  I will stay clear of this one.

Bottle poured an amber hue with a nice thick 2 inch lace.  Nose is intense floral citrus with a hint of alcohol.  I really enjoyed the flavor profile of this one it still had a somewhat dry hop finish even at 7.7% a.b.v. The only thing missing was a nice malt balance.  The palate of this one is drinkable if you like Double I.P.A.s  Overall I think I would have another.

12 oz. bottle pours a nice amber hue leaving a slightly off-white head.  Great nose with citrusy grapefruit and fresh hops.  Flavor is balanced with caramel and malty toffee; a true american session beer.  I could drink this one til the end.

Bottle pours a deep brown color with a 2 finger tan head that retained well.  Flavor is big malt character with big body and roast chocolate toffee flavors.  This is a very interesting interpretation of a Brown Ale very drinkable and gets better as it warms.  I would reccomend this one to anyone that is a fan of English style brown ales.
